questions.question_text: Which of the following relation is true according to the given expression "U + V $ W ^ X + Y"?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (66-69): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. If in coded language, A # B means 'A is the daughter of B', A ^ B means 'A is the father of B', A + B means 'A is the sister of B', A $ B means 'A is the wife of B'

options.text: Y is the daughter of U
X is the son of V
U is the brother-in-law of W

questions.question_text: How H is related to M?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (70-71): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are seven members G, H, E, J, K, M and O in a family. E has two children. H is the son of G, who is not the father of H. O is the daughter-in-law of K. G and E are a married couple. K is the sister of H. J is the grandson of G. M is the son-in-law of E.

questions.question_text: How G is related to K?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (70-71): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are seven members G, H, E, J, K, M and O in a family. E has two children. H is the son of G, who is not the father of H. O is the daughter-in-law of K. G and E are a married couple. K is the sister of H. J is the grandson of G. M is the son-in-law of E.

questions.question_text: How E is related to L?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (72-74): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. The information is given about a family of three generations - C is the father of E, who is married to U. F is the sister-in-law of U. I is the brother of D, who is the spouse of C. F is the niece of I, who is the son of L.

questions.question_text: How is D related to U?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (72-74): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. The information is given about a family of three generations - C is the father of E, who is married to U. F is the sister-in-law of U. I is the brother of D, who is the spouse of C. F is the niece of I, who is the son of L.

questions.question_text: If E is male then how is E related to I?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (72-74): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. The information is given about a family of three generations - C is the father of E, who is married to U. F is the sister-in-law of U. I is the brother of D, who is the spouse of C. F is the niece of I, who is the son of L.

questions.question_text: Who among the following is one of the siblings?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (75-77): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are eight members in a family consisting of three generations and three married couples. C is the husband of B and father of F. G is the sister-in-law of B and wife of H. B doesn't have any siblings. D is the paternal grandfather of A and father-in-law of B. F is the only grandson of E, who has only one son.

questions.question_text: Which of the following relation is true?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (75-77): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are eight members in a family consisting of three generations and three married couples. C is the husband of B and father of F. G is the sister-in-law of B and wife of H. B doesn't have any siblings. D is the paternal grandfather of A and father-in-law of B. F is the only grandson of E, who has only one son.

options.text: B is the sister of H
D is the mother-in-law of B
F is the niece of G
H is the brother-in-law of C

questions.question_text: What is the difference between the number of male and female members in this family?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (75-77): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are eight members in a family consisting of three generations and three married couples. C is the husband of B and father of F. G is the sister-in-law of B and wife of H. B doesn't have any siblings. D is the paternal grandfather of A and father-in-law of B. F is the only grandson of E, who has only one son.

questions.question_text: If the expression A @ B % C % D @ E is definitely true, which of the following statement is true?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (78-81): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. If in coded language, 'P $ Q' means 'Q is the father of P', 'P % Q' means 'P is the daughter of Q', 'P * Q' means 'P is the son of Q', 'P @ Q' means 'Q is the sister of P'

options.text: B is the son of C
A is the sister of B
D is the grandmother of B
C is the niece of E

questions.question_text: If the expression L @ M % N $ O @ K is definitely true, which of the following statement is not true?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (78-81): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. If in coded language, 'P $ Q' means 'Q is the father of P', 'P % Q' means 'P is the daughter of Q', 'P * Q' means 'P is the son of Q', 'P @ Q' means 'Q is the sister of P'

options.text: K is the aunt of N
O is the grandfather of M
M is the daughter of N
N is the son of O

questions.question_text: Kirti is the sister of Rohit. Aneeta is the daughter of Jay, who is the husband of Rani. Naina, who is the mother of Rohit, is also the daughter of Rani, who is the mother-in-law of Dev. Dev has only one son. How Rani is related to Rohit?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (78-81): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside.

questions.question_text: Prem is the brother of Tarun. Anjali is the daughter of Tarun. Reena is the mother-in-law of Anjali. Reena is married to Suraj. Sanjay is the only son of Suraj. How Anjali is related to Prem?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (78-81): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside.

questions.question_text: Who is the sister of D?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (82-83): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are eight members in the family A, D, E, G, I, M, O and N. D is the brother-in-law of A. M is the wife of E. I is unmarried. Only N is the son-in-law of E. O is married and is the sister-in-law of I. A is the only sister of O. I is the son of M.

questions.question_text: How many brother-in-laws does N have?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (82-83): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are eight members in the family A, D, E, G, I, M, O and N. D is the brother-in-law of A. M is the wife of E. I is unmarried. Only N is the son-in-law of E. O is married and is the sister-in-law of I. A is the only sister of O. I is the son of M.

questions.question_text: How Tarak is related to Manu?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (84-85): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are 8 members in a family. Geeta is mother of Chandan who is married to Manu. Vikas is the father of Tarak. Harsh is the father of Manu. Vikas and Manu are siblings. Chandan is the son of Gaurav. Tarak is the only child of Maya.

questions.question_text: How Chandan is related to Vikas?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (84-85): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are 8 members in a family. Geeta is mother of Chandan who is married to Manu. Vikas is the father of Tarak. Harsh is the father of Manu. Vikas and Manu are siblings. Chandan is the son of Gaurav. Tarak is the only child of Maya.

questions.question_text: What is the relation of R with respect to Q?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (86-88): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are ten members M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V in a family consisting of three generations and three married couples. V is the aunt of O who is the sibling of U. T is married to N and has two sons, neither of whom are married. S and P are males and neither of them are the brother-in-law of V. T is the maternal grandmother of U who is female. Q has no sisters but exactly one nephew. R is female member of the family.

questions.question_text: Who among the following is married to the sibling of S's brother-in-law?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (86-88): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are ten members M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V in a family consisting of three generations and three married couples. V is the aunt of O who is the sibling of U. T is married to N and has two sons, neither of whom are married. S and P are males and neither of them are the brother-in-law of V. T is the maternal grandmother of U who is female. Q has no sisters but exactly one nephew. R is female member of the family.

questions.question_text: Which among the following statement is true?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (86-88): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are ten members M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V in a family consisting of three generations and three married couples. V is the aunt of O who is the sibling of U. T is married to N and has two sons, neither of whom are married. S and P are males and neither of them are the brother-in-law of V. T is the maternal grandmother of U who is female. Q has no sisters but exactly one nephew. R is female member of the family.

options.text: N is the grandmother of O
V is the brother-in-law of M
N is the mother-in-law of S
M is the father of U

questions.question_text: How C is related to F?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (89-92): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are nine members in a family consisting of three generations and having three married couples. N is the father of C and the brother-in-law of T. Neither H nor N has sibling. E is the daughter of the one who is sister-in-law of N. T is the unmarried person in the family. R is the father-in-law of H and the spouse of G who is the maternal grandmother of E. C and E are of opposite gender. F is the sister of T who is the aunt of C who is not child of F. H is the son-in-law of G who is the mother-in-law of the one who is spouse of O.

questions.question_text: How many female members are there in the family?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (89-92): Read the following information carefully and answer the questions given beside. There are nine members in a family consisting of three generations and having three married couples. N is the father of C and the brother-in-law of T. Neither H nor N has sibling. E is the daughter of the one who is sister-in-law of N. T is the unmarried person in the family. R is the father-in-law of H and the spouse of G who is the maternal grandmother of E. C and E are of opposite gender. F is the sister of T who is the aunt of C who is not child of F. H is the son-in-law of G who is the mother-in-law of the one who is spouse of O.

questions.question_text: How is G related to F?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (93-95): Relations of a family are given in a coded language using symbols. Study the following information carefully and answer the questions given below. A # B means 'A is the husband of B', A $ B means 'A is the mother of B', A % B means 'A is the brother of B', A ^ B means 'A is the child of B', A @ B means 'A is the parent of B', A © B means 'A is the daughter of B', A * B means 'A is the daughter-in-law of B', A € B means 'A is the uncle of B'. A # I @ K % G $ J % D © L ^ C $ B $ F © H € J, E @ B

questions.question_text: How is B related to C?
questions.data_paragraph: A, B, C, D, E, F and G are seven relatives. E is the daughter-in-law of G. C is the niece of F. D is the son-in-law of B. A is the father of F. D has one daughter. E has no siblings. There are more males than females among them.

questions.question_text: What is the shortest distance between the points H and F?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (102-104): Study the following information and answer the given questions carefully. John started walking from point A. Point B is 20 cm north of point A. Point A is 6 cm east of point H. Point B is 6cm west of point G. Point C is 6 cm west of point E. Point D is 20 cm south of point G. Point C is the midpoint of points D and G. Point E is 10 cm north of point F.

questions.question_text: In which direction is point H with respect to point G?

questions.data_paragraph: Directions (107-108): Study the following information and answer the given questions carefully. Q is to the south of P. A is to the west of B, which is to the west of C. D is to the south of B. P is to the west of A.

questions.question_text: How far and in which direction is point V with respect to point Y?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (109-113): Study the following information and answer the given questions carefully. Nine points (S, T, U, V, W, X, Y, Z and A) are at different distances and directions from each other. W is 30m to the south of Y, which is 16m to the west of T. The distance between V and X is equal to the distance between T and U. Z is 28m to the east of X. The distance between X and Z is double the distance between Y and Z, which is to the south of Y. V is 14m to the south of T. S is 12m to the west of U, which is to the west of Y. V is 16m north of A.

questions.question_text: In which direction is point S with respect to point A?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (109-113): Study the following information and answer the given questions carefully. Nine points (S, T, U, V, W, X, Y, Z and A) are at different distances and directions from each other. W is 30m to the south of Y, which is 16m to the west of T. The distance between V and X is equal to the distance between T and U. Z is 28m to the east of X. The distance between X and Z is double the distance between Y and Z, which is to the south of Y. V is 14m to the south of T. S is 12m to the west of U, which is to the west of Y. V is 16m north of A.

questions.question_text: In a row where all are facing north, Priya is 15th from the left end and Garima is 19th from the right end. They interchange their positions, and Ram who sits 24th from the left end sits at the 5th place to the left of Priya's new position. How many persons were there in the row?

questions.question_text: During a prize distribution ceremony, Vikram was ninth from the left while Janhvi was eighth from the right in the front row. questions.question_text: Statements: Some A are B, All B are C, Some C are D. Conclusions: I. Some A are C II. Some D are A III. Some C are B
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (202-206): In each question some statements are followed by some conclusions. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the given statements.

questions.question_text: How many cubes having red, green and black colours on at least one side of the cube will be formed?
questions.data_paragraph: Directions (222-226): The following questions are based on the information given below: 1. A cuboid shaped wooden block has 6 cm length, 4 cm breadth and 1 cm height. 2. Two faces measuring 4 cm x 1 cm are coloured in black. 3. Two faces measuring 6 cm x 1 cm are coloured in red. 4. Two faces measuring 6 cm x 4 cm are coloured in green. 5. The block is divided into equal cubes of side 1 cm.
